channel.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
channel.description:
Hello. I have been up for hours, searching for the most commonly used proxies, and have found about 5,000 of them. This took about 6 hours to arrange all of this properly, but it's worth it. I'm not sure if the Hotspot Shield IP's are in these, but I will get them soon (Hopefully). Please, if you use comment below.
Reason I Spent my time doing this: Many people were using proxies on my server, and I got tired of it. I blocked the popular ones, and will get HotSpot IP's soon, hopefully.
If you want a Direct list of the proxies, Click here: [url=http://pvp-turf.com/other/proxy.txt]http://pvp-turf.com/other/proxy.txt[/url]
If you want a download, Click here: [url=http://uppit.com/b25zu62520ne/proxy.txt]http://uppit.com/b25zu62520ne/proxy.txt[/url]

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @AuDiOdreams AuDiOdreams
item.description:
@AuDiOdreams wrote:

Or just set up a max connections… That way only a certain amount of people from one ip can log in at a time. Also, if you make text appear when you log in, the players wont be able to talk until they click ok, or next. Like for example…

I logged in, a screen appears at the bottom where players text goes

“Hello, welcome to _ _ _ _scape.”
click next to continue

This way, players won’t have the ability to talk, until they click next to continue. That will stop the spamming of words most definitely.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If you don’t want people to crash your server or spam it, just use an ArrayList to handle all your connections and just reject the ones that try to spam or try to harm your server.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @PvPTurf PvPTurf
item.description:
@PvPTurf wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:348895”][quote author=Mod Whip link=topic=445268.msg3269376#msg3269376 date=1279085302]

I wouldn’t just arbitrarily ban IPs on your server, you should only ban IPs if you actually have problems with them.

Also, it’s against the rules to ask for rep, so please edit your post.

I have problems hourly. Why leave yourself vulnerable to Proxy’s if you can block them. It’s not really worth the headache. I editted my post, thanks for telling me.

Because all proxies aren’t bad. Some people have to use proxies. If you are having problems, why not just have your server automatically kick and ban bad players?

That’s actually a good point. Is there a way to grab a user’s MAC address when they’re logging on to the server and work with that?
[/quote]

No, they are just used locally and wouldn’t do you any good to get them on your server if you could (you would have to have the client send them to you, but it could just send a random one every time as well)

The only way to defend against bots is the same way jagex does it, try to detect them and then ban them. Random events are a good solution.[/quote]

I took those IP’s out of my server. Now I have all hotspot shield IP’s, and other free proxy’s IP’s.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mod Whip, post:12, topic:348895”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=445268.msg3269356#msg3269356 date=1279083304]

I wouldn’t just arbitrarily ban IPs on your server, you should only ban IPs if you actually have problems with them.

Also, it’s against the rules to ask for rep, so please edit your post.

I have problems hourly. Why leave yourself vulnerable to Proxy’s if you can block them. It’s not really worth the headache. I editted my post, thanks for telling me.

Because all proxies aren’t bad. Some people have to use proxies. If you are having problems, why not just have your server automatically kick and ban bad players?
[/quote]
That’s actually a good point. Is there a way to grab a user’s MAC address when they’re logging on to the server and work with that?[/quote]

No, they are just used locally and wouldn’t do you any good to get them on your server if you could (you would have to have the client send them to you, but it could just send a random one every time as well)

The only way to defend against bots is the same way jagex does it, try to detect them and then ban them. Random events are a good solution.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @Elux Elux
item.description:
@Elux wrote:

Oh gosh, so hard to copy and paste 5,000 ips that probably no longer work.
10’s of thousands of new proxies are created each day. You may aswell go ahead and ban every ip on the net if ur looking to ban all proxies.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server

item.title: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
item.dc:creator: @AuDiOdreams AuDiOdreams
item.description:
@AuDiOdreams wrote:

I'm not sure how to have my server autoban/kick players who use a ghostmouse when buying/thieving. You made a point there, but if they had trouble, and needed a proxy, I could simply give them an unbanned one.

Well, you could always create a random event. That way, if they do auto, they have a higher chance of getting a random if you make it to where the more you click, the higher your chances are, or just simply make it to where every so often, you get a random. Then from there, you can go two ways, you can either make the random automatically log out if they don’t answer it, or answer it incorrectly. Or you can make it to where if they don’t answer it in a certain amount of time, that it auto kicks/bans them.

And if you are getting spammed from people, and right when they log in they are saying stuff, make it to where a server message pops up right when new players log in… that way, they have to click out of the message before they can start typing.

hope this helped give you a little idea to help stop the spamming.

Read full topic
item.source: 5K Proxy IP's to Block on your Server
